data.title: About Us – Troup County Tax – Official Site
data.text:
Services

The Troup County Tax Commissioner’s Office offers a variety of services to the public, such as:

Selling and renewing your automobile tag

Collecting property taxes

Collecting mobile home taxes

Collecting timber taxes

Processing title transfers

Property Taxes

The official deadline for property taxes is November 15th. After this date penalties and interest accrue. You may pay your property taxes online at Troup County’s online tax payment system.

Car Buyers

New legislation effective January 1, 2011, will require a person purchasing a vehicle from an individual to register the vehicle within seven business days. Cardboard tags in lieu of proper license tags will no longer be permitted.

The following documents must be submitted to the local tag office:

Certificate of title

Bill of sale

Previous owner’s registration

Proof of insurance

Title Ad Valorem Tax (TAVT) for 2020 is set at 6.6%.

New Residents to Georgia pay TAVT at a rate of 3%. (New Georgia Law effective July 1, 2019)

Answers to many questions on this new law are answered here: DOR.GA.GOV

To calculate this new tax please visit: TAVT

If you would like to take advantage of alternative payment methods, please use our online payment, or IVR phone payment number, 1-855-508-6636.
